subject: College Athletics
Basketball
lead_paragraph: North Carolina was selected as the No. 1 team in The Associated Press’s preseason Top 25, the first unanimous No. 1 since the preseason poll began in 1981-82. North Carolina has the top six scorers — including the national player of the year Tyler Hansbrough — back from a team that had a team-record 36 wins and reached the Final Four. The Tar Heels are the preseason No. 1 for the second straight year, joining Nevada-Las Vegas in 1989-90 and 1990-91 as the only teams to do so. It also marks North Carolina’s record sixth time atop the preseason rankings, breaking a tie with Duke. Connecticut, which returns four starters, was No. 2, followed by Louisville, U.C.L.A. and Pittsburgh.
